medical_history.chief_complaint: Palpitations and central chest pressure radiating to the back associated with dyspnea at rest.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Three days before the visit, the patient developed palpitations and chest pressure with dyspnea. The palpitations had an intensity of 140 to 160 beats per minute with regular rhythm, which slowed with the Valsalva maneuver. Symptoms resolved upon arrival at the emergency department, where vital signs normalized.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension and degenerative joint disease. Previous hospitalization for severe headaches and elevated blood pressure two months prior.
medical_history.family_history: A paternal cousin died shortly after receiving morphine for a kidney stone; another paternal cousin died in his twenties of uncertain causes. No family history of premature coronary artery disease or confirmed sudden cardiac death.
medical_history.social_history: Occasional alcohol consumption, 1 caffeinated beverage daily. No tobacco or illicit drug use. Employed as a mechanical engineer and married with 2 young daughters.
